- <img src="media/ibm-blue.png" height="15" style="vertical-align: middle;"/> I'm a Salesforce Architect at IBM with a passion for governance, auditability, standards, and extensible architectural design
- <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dschach/dschach/main/media/Salesforce-logo.png" height="15" style="vertical-align: middle;"/> I've been working on Salesforce since the [Summer 06](https://resources.docs.salesforce.com/142/latest/en-us/sfdc/pdf/salesforce_summer06_release_notes.pdf) release (142, API 7.0) (Yes, that's a long time!)
- üíº To see a list of some things I've done, check out my [online portfolio](https://my.visualcv.com/dschach_website/)

##### LATEST NEWS

- üå± Lots of work on Github Actions!
  - Using [Release Please](https://github.com/googleapis/release-please), a wonderful changelog generator from Google, with Github actions, expanding it to [create an AppExchange package](https://github.com/dschach/packaging-action-test) automatically when a new project version is released.
  - Automatically [rename Dependabot pull requests](https://github.com/dschach/github-actions/blob/main/.github/workflows/LOCAL-dependabot-approve-and-auto-merge.yml) so they are more useful in changelogs and semver-compliant
  - A repository of starter GitHub workflows: [https://github.com/x2od/.github](https://github.com/x2od/.github)
- <img style="vertical-align: middle;" src="media/mend-io-favicon.png" alt="mend renovate logo" height="15" /> Configuring [Renovate](https://github.com/apps/renovate) as a <img src="./media/dependabot.png" height="15" style="vertical-align: middle;" /> Dependabot replacement and exploring custom configurations for that tool: [Renovate central configuration](https://github.com/dschach/github-actions/blob/main/renovate.json5) and [a local extension](https://github.com/dschach/github-actions/blob/main/renovate.json)
- üêá AutoRABIT's product [CodeScan](https://www.autorabit.com/codescan/) has fast become one of my favorite tools. It's like PMD on steroids, with memory, so you can mark violations in PR branches and the tool magically remembers the override after you merge to main!
- <img style="vertical-align: middle;" src="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/9039821" alt="HighlightJS logo" height="15" width="15" /> I released an updated [Apex highlighter](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlightjs-apex) plugin for [highlight.js](https://highlightjs.org/) so any Apex on a webpage will look great - and I published it to [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/package/highlightjs-apex)!
  - It now comes with an (optional) [Monokai theme](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlightjs-apex/blob/main/src/styles/monokai-sublime-apex.css) that mimics the wonderful MavensMate Sublime Text Monokai theme.
  <!-- - <img style="vertical-align: middle;" src="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/9039821" alt="dschach" height="15" width="15" /> I also released a [Visualforce highlighter](https://github.com/dschach/highlightjs-visualforce) plugin for [highlight.js](https://highlightjs.org/) so any Apex on a webpage will look great - and I published it to [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/package/highlightjs-visualforce)! -->

##### UP NEXT

- Exploring AutoRABIT's [Automated Release Management](https://www.autorabit.com/products/automated-release-management/) (ARM) product for CI/CD in Salesforce.
- Building a repository or gist of my favorite custom XPath static code analysis rules (Apex, XML, HTML, etc)
- I'm a fan of [Gearset](https://gearset.com) for straightforward pipelines, and I think that it could work well with Release-Please, even though R-P recommends Squash Merging and Gearset does simple merges. It would involve complex linting, possibly, but could enable Salesforce admins/devs to see a concise changelog of all changes pushed to Production with dates!
- I'd like to add some features to Mitch Spano's [Apex Trigger Actions Framework](https://github.com/mitchspano/trigger-actions-framework). I'm considering per-user global bypasses, allowing multiple custom permissions to bypass execution, an option to debug limits, and some other things. Thoughts?
- Have you used [ApexDox](https://github.com/no-stack-dub-sack/apexdox-vs-code)? I am thinking of updating it and putting in some cool features. What would you like to see it do? All my repos have ApexDox sites - [here's a great example](https://dschach.github.io/salesforce-trigger-framework).

##### COOL PROJECTS

üî≠ These are some of the <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dschach/dschach/main/media/Salesforce-logo.png" height="15" style="vertical-align: middle;"/> Salesforce projects I'm proud of

- [RecordTypes utility class](https://github.com/dschach/record-types)
- [Enhanced Duplicate Record Handling](https://github.com/dschach/duplicatehandling)
- [Campaing Member Status](https://github.com/x2od/campaign-member-status/) (adapted from Sercante LLC)
- A simple [Trigger Framework](https://github.com/dschach/salesforce-trigger-framework)
- <img src="media/labs.png" height="15" width="15" style="vertical-align: middle;"/> I revised and released [ACTION PLANS version 4](https://github.com/SalesforceLabs/ActionPlansV4) from Salesforce Labs! Find it on the [AppExchange](https://sforce.co/3wWTEqK)
- üìã I rewrote large chunks of [Surveyforce](https://github.com/SalesforceLabs/survey-force) - check it out!
- <img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/prettier/prettier-logo/refs/heads/master/images/prettier-icon-light.png" height="15" style="vertical-align: middle;"/> A reusable [Prettier config](https://github.com/x2od/prettier-config) for all my projects. It is so helpful to edit in one place (with overrides in each project)
- [Kevin Poorman](https://github.com/codefriar) and I have been working on [ApexKit](https://github.com/codefriar/ApexKit), which is a very cool set of tools for Apex
  <!-- - [Quote Custom Sync](https://github.com/x2od/QuoteCustomSync) using custom metadata -->

##### ACHIEVEMENTS

- :us: Original Salesforce Architect for the Obama reelection campaign
